repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: Collection contains minutes, contracts, reports, legislative bills, statements, publications, correspondence, memos, and testimony from 1926-1983 relating to Ida Merriam's work with the Social Security Bureau of Research and Statistics.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Ida Merriam papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ida C. Merriam (1904-1997) began working in Social Security in 1936, when she joined what become the Social Security Administration's Research and Statistics Bureau. She rose to become head of the Bureau's Division of Coordination Studies, then became Assistant Director and then Director of Research and Statistics. She retired in 1972 after finishing her distinguished career as Assistant Commissioner of the Office of Research and Statistics.

During her years at Social Security, Merriam led groundbreaking studies on disability and health insurance, drafted major reports for congressional committees, and directed the publication of Social Security technical studies and statistics. She was a founding member of the National Academy of Social Insurance. In 1966 was one of six winners of the Federal Woman's Award.
She graduated in 1925 from Wellesley University and went on to earn a doctorate in economics from the Brookings Graduate School of Economics and Government in 1928.
Ida Merriam died on April 8, 1997 at the age of 92.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains minutes, contracts, reports, legislative bills, statements, publications, correspondence, memos, and testimony. This material dates from 1926-1983. These papers relate to the Merriam's work with the Social Security Bureau of Research and Statistics.

The materials within this collection represent a broad range of research topics associated with the Social Security Administration. Administrative files outlining Social Security Administration goals illustrate major research and policy interests of the time period. Strengths of the collection include documents relating to health and disability insurance, poverty studies, and welfare.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: Administrative files, Legislation, Reports and studies

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Addition to collection added in April 2018 (ACC2018.012).

controlaccess.subject: Social security
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Social Security Administration. Division of Research and Statistics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative documents including coorespondence, memoranda, meeting minutes, and notes. This material dates from 1935-1983. Topics include Social Security Administration goals, health insurance, woman and Social Security, Medicare, Old-Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance (OASDI), International Social Security Association research conference materials, and food stamp plans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains drafts of bills, bill proposals, memoranda, and notes. The material dates from 1935-1972. Topics include various heath insurance-related legislation such as the Wagner-Murray-Dingell Bill, drafted to create a national social insurance system. Other topics include Old-Age and Survivors Insurance (OASI) legislation, Social Security legislation amendments, and hospital insurance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The materials of this series include statistical reports papers, and general reference materials related to the Social Security Administration. The material dates from 1934-1979. Topics include the United Nations Report on the World Social Situation, Social Security Bulletins with statistical supplements, and economic and welfare studies.
